lines.text: "Falling Down Stairs." There are many ways of doing this if you aren't careful. The "Bumps-a-daisy Half Twist"...
[Donald sets a TV set down at the top of the stairs, his feet get tangled in the cord and it falls down taking him with it]
"Jelly roll"...
[Donald trips and gets wrapped up in the red rug and rolls down the stairs in it]
"Catapult High Dive"...
[Donald steps onto a loose stair board and it sends him into the air]
"Climbing Mount Everest"...
[Donald carries many, many heavy things upstairs and he falls back down with them]
"Riding a Rolly Coaster"!
[Donald slips into a toy wagon and goes down the stairs]
Now Mr. Duck doesn't take chances, he's just careless.
[Donald leans against the banister and it breaks sending him down to the first floor]
Oh yes! That's one I forgot to mention.

[angrily]
That's the last straw!
[cleans up the house to make it much safer]
I'm going to work, where it's safe!

[Donald's cleaning his shirt next to the hot stove cooking dinner]
Cleaning fluid plus stove equals... *a sure-fire method for removing spots*!
[jumps into the bread box as a flaming explosion ensues from Donald's carelessness]
fate!
Listen to him blame me for his carelessness.
[scoffs]
[First lines]
Howdy. I'm J.J. Fate, fall guy. My middle name is Jonah, and Jinx is in there, too. Hoodoo fits me like a glove, but Fate's my name to you.

You know, accidents don't just happen by themselves. They have to be carelessly planned in advance. So step right up and have an accident. The average home is really a complicated piece of machinery, equipped with all the modern conveniences... for having an accident, if you inisist.
[Donald lights up a pipe in a gas leak; explosion follows]
He did.
Do you realize that nearly five million people suffered in home accidents last year? And everybody blames me, daggnabit!
[Last lines]
This is an average neighborhood.
[a house has its roof blown off]
These are average homes.
[Another house bursts into flames]
Average people live here...
[a man is seen shooting out of a chimney]
... having average accidents.
[a couple more homes explode; a car breaks out a close garage]
Don't blame me for your carelessness.
